class chainsaw.active.activesaw(*things, **kw)[source]¶

active chainsaw

all()¶

Tell if everthing in a series of things is True.

any()¶

Tell if anything in a series of things is True

append(thing)¶

Place things before any current incoming things.

@param thing: wannabe incoming things

appendfront(thing)¶

Place thing before any current incoming things.

@param thing: one wannabe incoming thing

arguments(*args, **kw)¶

Assign arguments to be used by the current or alternative callable.

as_ascii(errors='strict')¶

Set wrapper to encode each thing in a series of things as string/byte type encoded as ascii (regardless of type)

@param errors: error handling (default: ‘strict’)

classmethod as_auto()¶

Context where incoming things are automatically rebalanced with outgoing things.

as_bytes(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

encode each incoming thing as byte string (regardless of type)

@param encoding: encoding for stringish things (default: ‘utf-8’) @param errors: error handling for encoding stringish things

(default: ‘strict’)
as_deque()¶

Set wrapper to deque type.

as_dict()¶

Set wrapper to dict type.

as_edit()¶

Switch to editing context where operations can be performed on incoming things from initial placement to final extraction.

as_frozenset()¶

Set iterable wrapper to frozenset type.

as_frozenstuf()¶

Set wrapper to frozenstuf type.

as_list()¶

Set wrapper to list type.

classmethod as_manual()¶

Context where incoming must be manually rebalanced with outgoing things.

as_many()¶

Switch to performing operations on each incoming thing as just one individual thing in a series of many individual things.

as_one()¶

Switch to performing operations on incoming things as one whole individual thing.

as_ordereddict()¶

Set wrapper to OrderedDict type.

as_orderedstuf()¶

Set iterable wrapper to orderedstuf type.

as_set()¶

Set iterable wrapper to set type.

as_stuf()¶

Set iterable wrapper to stuf type.

as_truth()¶

Switch to evaluation context where the results of operations on incoming things determine which of two potential paths to execute. After exting the evaluation context, incoming things automatically revert to a prior baseline snapshot of incoming things so further operations can be performed on the unmodified version.

as_tuple()¶

Set wrapper to tuple type.

as_unicode(encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

Set wrapper to decode each thing in a series of things as unicode type (regardless of type).

@param encoding: encoding for stringish things (default: ‘utf-8’) @param errors: error handling for decoding stringish things

(default: ‘strict’)
as_view()¶

Switch to query context where incoming things can be extracted and transformed so that the results of chainsawing them can be queried. Upon exit from query context by invoking results or end, all incoming things automatically revert to a prior baseline snapshot of incoming things so that further operations can be performed on the unmodified version.

average()¶

Average value within a series of things.

balanced¶

Determine if ins and out are in balance

choice()¶

Select a random choice from a series of things.

clear()¶

Clear out everything.

clear_in()¶

Clear incoming things.

clear_out()¶

Clear outgoing things.

combinations(n)¶

Each possible combinations for every number of things within a series of things.

@param n: number of things to derive combinations from

concat()¶

Concatenate a series of things into one series of things.

copy()¶

Duplicate each thing in a series of things

count()¶

Number of incoming things.

count_out()¶

Number of outgoing things.

difference(symmetric=False)¶

The difference between a series of things.

@param symmetric: use symmetric difference (default: False)

disjointed()¶

The disjoint between a series of things.

end()¶

Return outgoing things and clear out every last thing.

extend(things)¶

Place things after any current incoming things.

@param things: wannabe incoming things

extendfront(things)¶

Place things after any current incoming thing.

@param thing: one wannabe incoming thing

filter(pattern=None, reverse=False, flags=0)¶

Things within a series of things that pass a filter. By default things that evaluate to True pass the filter but if the reverse flag is set to True than things that evaluate to False pass the filter while things that evaluate to False do not. If a pattern is supplied the filter will be a regular expression. Otherwise the current callable will be used.

@param pattern: regular expression search pattern (default: None) @param reverse: return things for which filter is False rather than

True (default: False)

@param flags: regular expression flags (default: 0)

find(pattern=None, reverse=False, flags=0)¶

The first in a series of things that pass a filter. By default things that evaluate to True pass the filter but if the reverse flag is set to True than things that evaluate to False pass the filter while things that evaluate to False do not. If a pattern is supplied the filter will be a regular expression. Otherwise the current callable will be used.

@param pattern: regular expression search pattern (default: None) @param reverse: return things for which filter is False rather than

True (default: False)

@param flags: regular expression flags (default: 0)

first(n=0)¶

Return either the specified number of things from the beginning of a series of things or just the first thing.

@param n: number of things (default: 0)

flatten()¶

Flatten a series of nested things into a flat series of things.

frequency()¶

Count of each thing in a series of things.

groupby()¶

Group things together using the current callable as the key function.

index(n, default=None)¶

Return each thing at a specified index in a series of incoming things or the passed default thing.

@param n: index of thing @param default: default thing (default: None)

initial()¶

Return everything within a series of things except the very last thing within the series of things.

intersection()¶

The intersection between a series of things.

invoke(name)¶

Invoke method name on each thing within a series of things with the current positio nnd keyword arguments but return the thing as the result if the method returns None.

@param name: method name

items(*keys)¶

Collect object items from a series of things matching their keys.

@param *keys: item keys

join(separator=u'', encoding='utf-8', errors='strict')¶

Combine a series of stringish things join into one unicode string (regardless of the original string type).

@param separator: string to join at (default: ‘’) @param encoding: encoding for stringish things (default: ‘utf-8’) @param errors: error handling when encoding stringish things

(default: ‘strict’)
last(n=0)¶

Return either the specified number of things from the end of a series of things or just the last thing.

@param n: number of things (default: 0)

map(args=False, kwargs=False, current=False)¶

Invoke current callable on each thing within a series of things. Pass results of iterable as *args to current callable if args flag is set. Pass results of iterable to current callable as tuple of *args and **kwargs if kwargs flag is set.

@param args: map each thing as a tuple of Python *args for current
callable (default: False)
@param kwargs: map each thing as a tuple of Python *args and
**kwargs for current callable (default: False)
@param current: map each thing as a tuple of Python *args and **kwargs
including current positional and keyword arguments for current callable (default: False)
mapping(keys=False, values=False)¶

Collect keys and values from a series of mappings.

@param keys: gather keys only (default: False) @param values: gather values only (default: False)

max()¶

Maximum value within a series of things using current callable as the key function.

median()¶

Median value within a series of things.

min()¶

Minimum value within a series of things using the current callable as the key function.

minmax()¶

Minimum and maximum values within a series of things.

partition(pattern=None, flags=0)¶

Divide a series of things into True and False things based on the results returned by the current callable.

@param pattern: regular expression search pattern (default: None) @param flags: regular expression flags (default: 0)

permutations(n)¶

Each possible permutation for every number of things within a series of things.

@param n: number of things to derive permutations from

preview()¶

Take a peek at the current state of outgoing things.

product(n=1)¶

Results of nested for each loops repeated a certain number of times.

@param n: number of loops to repeat (default: 1)

quantify()¶

Number of how many times current callable evaluates to True in a series of things.

range()¶

Statistical range within a series of things.

reduce(initial=None, reverse=False)¶

Reduce a series of things down to one thing using the current callable. If reverse flag is set, reduction will come from the right side of the series. Otherwise, reduction will come from the left side of the series.

@param initial: initial thing (default: None) @param reverse: reduce from right side of things (default: False)

repeat(n=None, call=False)¶

Repeat a series of things or the results of the current callable.

@param n: number of times to repeat (default: None) @param call: repeat result of current callable (default: False)

replace(pattern, new, count=0, flags=0)¶

Replace segments within a series of strings with a new string segment if they match a pattern.

@param pattern: regular expression search pattern @param new: replacement string @param count: number of replacements to make in a string (default: 0) @param flags: regular expression flags (default: 0)

rest()¶

Return everything within a series of things except the very first thing within the series of things.

results()¶

Return outgoing things and clear outgoing things.

reverse()¶

Reverse the order of a series of things.

sample(n)¶

Take a random sample drawn from a series of things.

@param n: sample size

shift_in()¶

Manually copy outgoing things to incoming things.

shift_out()¶

Manually copy incoming things to outgoing things.

shuffle()¶

Randomly reorder a series of things.

slice(start, stop=False, step=False)¶

Slice a series of things down to a certain size.

@param start: starting point of slice @param stop: stopping point of slice (default: False) @param step: size of step in slice (default: False)

snapshot(baseline=False, original=False)¶

Take a snapshot of current incoming things.

@param baseline: make snapshot baseline version (default: False) @param original: make snapshot original version (default: False)

sort()¶

Sort a series of things using the current callable as the key function.

split(n, fill=None)¶

Split a series of things into series of things of a specified length using fill argument to pad out incomplete series.

@param n: number of things per split @param fill: value to pad out incomplete things (default: None)

subset()¶

Tell if a series of things is a subset of other series of things.

sum(start=0, floats=False)¶

Add the value of a series of things together.

@param start: starting number (default: 0) @param floats: incoming are floats (default: False)

superset()¶

Tell if a series of things is a superset of another series of things.

tap(call, alt=None, factory=False)¶

Assign current callable and, optionally, an alternative callable. If factory flag is set, use the call argument as a factory for building the current callable.

@param call: primary callable to assign @param alt: alternative callable to assign (default: None) @param factor: whether call is a callable factory (default: False)

undo(snapshot=0, baseline=False, original=False)¶

Revert incoming things to a previous snapshot of incoming things.

@param snapshot: steps ago 1, 2, 3 steps, etc.. (default: 0) @param baseline: return ins to baseline version (default: False) @param original: return ins to original version (default: False)

union()¶

The union between two series of things.

unique()¶

Get unique things within a series of things while preserving order and remember everything ever encountered.

untap()¶

Clear current callable, alternative callable, and stored arguments.

unwrap()¶

Set wrapper to list type.

weave()¶

Interleave a series of things into one thing.

which(call=None, alt=None)¶

Choose current callable based on results of condition mode

@param call: external callable to use if condition is True @param alt: external callable to use if condition if False

wrap(wrapper)¶

Iterable wrapper for outgoing things.

@param wrapper: an iterable wrapper

zip()¶

Reduce of a series of things down to one thing, pairing each things by their position in the series.
